text: Bottle shared. Pours cloudy gold with thin white head. Aroma is banana, dough, pepper, yeast with light citrus notes. Tart Apple Green skin flavor. Banana sweet finish. Me carbonation. Lime is prominent. Lovely beer.

Pours a pretty clear golden color with a bit of a copper tint to it. small to medium white head. Nose of lemon sourness, a bit of flowery notes and some pale malt, hay notes. Taste is a bit sweet at first, then you get the medium tartness dry finish. Body is medium. it is easily drinkable and very well balanced.

750ml bottle, with a hazy blonde hue and a frothy white head. Very nice juicy lim, blood orange citrusy nose, with some funky wild, saison yeast, tart, sour rhubarb, subtle lemongrass, lemon pie crust, doughy accents and a bread dough, subtle sour green apple note in he aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a good fruity zesty, spritzy juicy acidic lime, lemon, blood orange rind character, with some sour wild funky saison yeast, pale, wheat sour malt mash, subtle lemon pepper, sour rhubarb, sour green apple, faint flowery citrusy hop flavours, leading towards a nice quenching fruity sourness citrusy dry finish.

Light golden hazy orange.
Nice n refreshing aroma of oranges, farm and lime. Flavor and body are light and delicate. Blood orange shines, as does the yeast. Great starter to an epic share.

Pours a semi hazy red orange color with a dissipating foam head that hugs my glass. The aroma is of fresh citrus, floral hops, yeast, hay, and malts. Tasting there is a citrus lime tart flavor, some acidity, subtle sweetness, very clean bitterness, and a crisp malted grain taste. The finish has a lime flavor lingers but soon fades. The bitterness is minor but enough to subdue the lime. I believe the blood orange might offer something to the bitterness that makes this unique. The body is spot on with good carbonation and mouth feel. It was also nicely balanced. Overall a drink worth trying. For me this is not an everyday drinker but each to their own.

On tap @Ma che siete venuti a fà (Rome). Bevuta a birre Sotto lAlbero 2016. Bellissimo color arancia, viva, solo un fili torbida, schiuma media bianca. Al naso è pulitissima, note di arancia, mandarino, agrumi, leggera speziatura, note floreali, fantastica. In bocca è un succo di frutta, molto equilibrata e di grande finezza, fruttata con note erbacee nel finale. Corpo medio, carbonazione leggera. Che meraviglia!

Magnum bottle pour at the RateBeer Best 2017 Grand Tasting/Bottle Share. Gusher. Hazy yellow with off-white head. Aromas of funk, citrus, light tart notes. Tastes of tart notes, citrus, stone fruit, light floral, subtle funk. Light body with a dry finish. Very nice.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. HFD #10 Mega pomarańczowe, skóra, bretty. Genialny profil kwasowości.

Bottle Sharing / Piwne Degustacje Kraków, Craftownia - Krakowski Wielokran  

Kolor pomarańczowy, piwo jest mętne. Fajna biała piana, pozostawia trwały lacing na szkle. Długo się utrzymuje.

Aromat cytrusowy, limonka, cytryna, pomarańcze, ananas. W oddali lekka brettowość, delikatna skóra, stajnia, siano. W smaku delikatne, mało dzikie, dość kwaśne. Dużo pomarańczy, skórek cytrusów, limonek, cytryn, a także białych winogron. Odrobina przypraw w tle. Sporo tutaj się dzieje. Średnie ciało, wysokie wysycenie, oleista tekstura.
Super pijalne, orzeźwiająće. Klasa światowa. Wyznacznik stylu.
Light copper with no foam. Barnyard, leather, lemon. Tart, dry. High carbonation with a light body.

Tasting at Alexs. 750ml, bottled on 18-Aug-2016 (thx, Alex M.!). Pours a hazy golden peche color with a white head. Aroma is funky, fruity, citrusy, earthy. Taste is the same. Just one more good balanced, pleasant easy drinkable stuff from HF.
Hunted by Sergey; bottled 2016 08 16Hazy golden color, small head. Delicate funky aroma, salami. Dry mouthfeel, some funk, some orange. Highly drinkable. Remarkable for its great harmony.

Tap at Ma Che Siete Venuti a Fà in Rome-Italy with Mortlach. Juicy orange skin bright color, medium white foam. Nose: rose grapefruit, bitter orange, aromatic tea, incense. Wow. Mouth: one of the most balanced beers. Grapefruit, lemon grass, herbs, lemon. Super clean and bit a citric tart finish kind of zest. Top.

750ml bottle from share. Pours out a hazy pale yellow/golden with a small frothy white head. Yeasty aroma, some savory spices, some citrus. Taste follows the same pattern. Smooth and velvety, mellow flavors to savor.

Sample at Shelton Bros fest. From notes- pale golden, white head. Nose fruity lime aid and barley, hay. Nice texture with notes of citrus lime tartness rounding out the finish. Crushable tart saison


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750 ml bottle
Pours a pinkish orange with light head.
Aromas of lemon/lime and light wheat.
Flavors of tart citrus dry yeast and more light wheat.

750ml bottle purchased at Hill Farmstead. Pours a hazy, soft rose, with hints of orange and yellow. Looks like freshly squeezed grapefruit juice. Smells sweet, citrus and of hibiscus. Champagne-y and tart in the nose much like the Florence. Tastes sour, tart, strong lime sourness and slight hibiscus flavor. Also present, slight orange-y almost grapefruit bitterness throughout. Lime definitely the most prominent flavor. Very light but tart mouthfeel. Exactly what you want in this type of beer. Very good. Could do with a better balance between hibiscus and lime but great nonetheless.

Bottle pour at the source. The beer is a hazy copper with a beige head of foam. The aroma has juicy fruit notes, some floral notes, moderately dry, definite sour notes. The sourness tones down as you drink. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Velvety mouthfeel.
Fat CBC-2016. Smak och doft av äpple, vinäger, hö, gräs, jord, krusbär, vita- och gröna vinbär, citrus och jäst. En riktig bra saison, fina rena smaker i god balans, frisk och syrlig. Mycket gott!

Aroma: Lime, Yeast, Mildly Grassy...
Appearance: Mildly Hazy Golden Straw Hue, Passes Some Light, Thin White Head Ring, No Lacing...
Taste: Lime Juice, Hibiscus, Mild Fruit Esters, Mild Yeast...
Mouthfeel: Average Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Mildly Tart

750 ml bottle purchase at the brewery on September 28, 2016. Hazy honey orange, small head. Dry orange herb aroma, notes of hoppy lime. Light hoppy grapefruit juice taste, notes of tart herbs, dry finish. Bim does it again!

Sample at Zwanze Day 2016 at Jolly Pumpkin. #50 saison! Aroma is tart, barnyard, funky, dusty, good. Appearance is dark golden, hazy, white head. Taste is tart, funky, barnyard, straw, dusty, good. Mouthfeel is light to medium body, light carbonation, tart barnyard aftertaste. Overall, this is a little disappointing.
Bottle pour, thanks Lutton for sharing. Slight cloudy gold pour, thin phome head, sweet acidic aroma, smooth tart taste little citrus and lime flavors. Very nice beer.

750 mL bottle poured. Huge thanks to luttonm, (and Chris) for the share! Always a treat. Tart promising, floral aroma. Fantastic, slightly tart lime constant. Juicy orange with a tart remainder. Slight floral. I want to drink a ton of this, but enjoy the slow savor. Very well executed saison here. Loved it.

Bottle in Seattle. Big thanks to Chris for bartering this to me. Dissipating pretty foam. Red grapefruit tinge to hazy orange. Gorgeous aroma, acidic and juicy citrus. Spicy lime acidity on sip. Rosy body. Clean, fruity, light acidity. Crazy delicious.

La bière est dune couleur orange / rosée avec très peu de carbonatation et deffervescence. Au nez, les levures sauvages volent la vedette. On reconnait également derrière la brett le côté levure saison à la vermontoise. En bouche, les oranges sanguines prennent toute la place, les bretts sont à peine distinguables. On a réellement limpression de goûter un San Pellegrino à lorange. Peu ou pas damertume. Corps assez rond. Taux de buvabilité ultra élevé. Bière solide.

Thanks Huhzubendah for sharing the bottle! Poured into a snifter showing cloudy orange with white foam gathering around the rims. 

The nose is as described - orannge and limenotes with hints of hibiscus/rose petals here and there. 

The palate is medium bodied and fully carbonated like a saison. Flavors of moderately intense blood oranges and hibiscus petals but completely dry. The mid-palate reveals a light bitterness and an even lighter citrus. The finish shows a light citric zest with a resurgence of light citrus on the linger.

UPDATED: FEB 14, 2017 750mL bottle. Pours a cloudy pinkish orange (clear, burnt orange if you dont pour the sediment) with a small white head. Aroma is tart with blood orange, funk, and hints of spice. Taste is tart, citrusy, somewhat sour with just a little yeast. Long, dry blood orange finish. Light body. Average carbonation. Smooth, creamy mouthfeel.

May 2015 bottle. Held up really well. Poured a hazy yellow with a big fluffy white head. Aromas of citrus, hay, funk, spice, tart. Flavor follows the nose with lemon, lime, orange, hay, slight spice, tart, and funk. Light body, sticky texture, lively carbonation, tart finish.

On tap at Warpigs, Copenhagen, Hill Farmstead tap takeover. Pours hazy yellow orange with white head. Fruity, citrus, grapefruit, barnyard, yeasty, funky. Light sweetness with pleasant refreshing sourness. Medium bodied. Very drinkable and very nice.

Bottle. Pours clear and orange with nice white head. Aroma of citrus, zest and bretts. In taste nicely tart, zesty and fruity, lightly sour. Medium to light body, medium carbonation, quite creamy. The finish is lightly tart and citrusy. Great beer.

Hill Farmestad tap takeover at Warpigs may 12th 2016. Unclear orange body with a small white head. Aroma of oranges, apples, funk, mild spicy. Crisp and zesty grapefruit and orange taste, mild sweetness, bretty and dry finish with lasting fresh fruit aftertaste. Pretty good stuff!

Bottle shared. Bit hazy golden with small white head. Lemon balm, light lactic sourness, milky dough, grassy and quite herbal, soft mineral notes and spicy yeast. Under medium sour, light sweet and bitter. Under medium bodied with a bit fizzy carbonation.

Bottle shared with friends.
No head. Hazy golden pour. A very good refreshing saison.

Draught @ [ Hill Farmsted Tape Take Over ] - Warpigs Brewpub, Flaesketorvet 24, DK-1711 Copenhagen, Denmark. [ As Hill Farmstead Brother Soigné ].Unclear - hazy matt medium orange yellow color with a small to average, frothy - fizzy, good lacing, mostly lasting to diminishing, off-white to white head. Aroma is moderate malty, pale malt, tart, grapefruit, flowers - perfume - yeast, barnyard, leather. Flavor is moderate sweet and light acidic with a average to long duration, grapefruit, tart, yeasty, funky, farmyard. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20160512]

Type: 8-oz. draft
Glass: Clear tulip glass
From: Alpine Beer Company Pub in Alpine, Calif.
Price: $8.00
Purchased: June 9, 2016
Consumed: June 9, 2016
Misc.: N/A

Stopped in to pick up a gift certificate and saw Hill Farmstead on the board. Insta-purchased. After looking up some more information, I dont think its actually Hill Farmstead, but Grassroots (which may just be a part of Hill Farmstead). Either way I was looking forward to trying it without even looking what the group thinkers on Beer Advocate and Untappd were saying.

Poured a golden orange clear color with 1-to-2 fingers of off-white, fizzy head. Some bubbles coming up from the bottom of the glass. Very good spotty lacing. Average retention. (Sight - 4.00)

Smelled spicy up front, then got orange blossom, blood orange, hibiscus, floral aromas, lime zest, pear, citrusy notes, grassy notes and light green apple. (Smell - 4.25)

Tasted even better than the nose, getting lime zest, citrus, blood orange, grass, herbal, pear, kiwi, hibiscus and hints of cinnamon spice. (Taste - 4.50)

Light body. Oily texture. Lively carbonation. Long, citrusy finish. (Feel - 4.50)

This one just grew on me. Really liked it, but I feel like I overrated it just a tad. (Overall - 4.25)

4.36 97 A

Thanks king hippo! Pours a hazy light orangish/yellowish color, with a fluffy white head. Beautiful looking beer in the glass. Aroma of lime, lemon zest, citrus, hay, grain and funk. Taste is a mouth puckering lemon and lime flavor, orange citrus, grapefruit, with some light grainy malts, funky tartness, and slight bitterness. Medium to light mouthful. Easily drinkable on a nice spring day. World class! Yes maam, may I please have another.
[5/12/16] Draught at Warpigs in Copenhagen. Cloudy pinkish orange. Aroma of funk, lacto, fruitiness, citrus. Tart flavor, fruity, citric, zesty, oak. Medium-bodied. Wonderful and really refreshing.

Hazy golden yellow in color... Aroma of citrus, grains, hay, lime, funk... Flavor is crisp and lightly tart, extremely smooth and light bodied on palate, lots of blood orange, hibiscus, lime up front, dissipates to nothing on the palate... Delicious

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Sample @ Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016 Blue session 20160513. Fruity and funky with citrusy and hoppy notes. The finish is dry and fruity with bretty notes.
Fat CBC-16. En riktig bra saison sauvage med mycket funk, frisk och syrlig med citrus, vete, jäst, lite blommig. Som jag önskar att varje saison skall smaka. Riktigt gott.

Bottle: Thanks MacBoost: Served in a Chouffe glass:
White head. Hazy bright yellow body.
Fine and crispy brett aroma with some floral and flower tones, some manure, subtle fruit ish tones and some wood.
Flavour is also quite crispy and light: brett, funk, lemon, light bitter, light tart, light wood...
Aftertaste is funky, bitter, light tart, brett and lemon.
Low carbo, light creamy mouthfeel, medium bodied.
Saison? Serious? Wild Ale! Yes it is!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

Yellow light pink orange hue, hazy. Tarty nose, citrussy, watermelonny. Med bodied, slight tart, fine fruity flavour. Nice balance, harmoneous beer.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

From tap at Warpigs, Copenhagen. Unclear golden orange color with small off white head. Yeasty and hoppy aroma, floral, citrusy fruity, lemon and orange, grapefruit, funky, bretty, spicy. sweet and acidic taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

Sample at CBC Blue Session. Pours hazy peachy orange/pink with white head. Lightly sour aroma with grapefruit, peach, citrus. Some tartness to it. Slightly tart grapefruit/apricot/peach taste. Hints of dry pepper. Fresh and easy.
On tap at CBC 2016. Pale peach with a white head. Citrus, cucumbers, lime and some brett. Refreshing.

Cold-hearted bastard that I am the only thing I like about warm weather is warm weather beer. Brother Soigne is a fantastic example. It pours golden yellow with lots of head and visible carbonation. Floral, citrusy, and funky aromas. A big dose of tartness and juice in the flavor profile. Sour funk and tangy orange and lime. Texture is bright, lively, and refreshing. Like many Hill Farmstead brews this is a seemingly simplistic brew that seems to blur the line between Sour and Saison. This is an ale for scorching days.
Tap @CBC16. hazy orange, small white head. Sourish aroma, plum skins. Slightly sour flavour, yellow plums and berries. Dry, bittersweet. Tasty.

Tap @ Warpigs. Unclear peachy/yellow with small white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, berries, hop, brett, lemon and citrus fruit, apricot?. Flavour is malt, fruot, peach, little dry, little lemon, brett, medium bitter and funky.

Sample at CBC 2016. 

Hazy orange with a white head. Fresh and funky with orange, citrus, grass, light yeast and some bread. Also some lime. The finish was tart. A refreshing one. Tasty.

Bottle from reynolds314-thanks! Almost two years old. Bit of a gusher. Strong lime component while pouring on the nose, some tart wheat. Taste is pretty standard tart farmhouse, but definitely lime note on the finish. Dont get the blood orange at all but this is really tasty, crushable stuff.

Draught @ Warpigs, Copenhagen. Pours slightly hazy orange with an offwhite head. Aroma is light sour, malt, yeast, hay, tart fruity, wood, grapes, sweet citrus. Flavor is sourness, yeast, hay, tart fruity, white wine, grapes, citrus, orange. Medium body, average carboantion, light acidic finish. 120516

(Thanks, Shawn! "MacBoost")

Bottle.

A- Lime juice, funk, brett, citrus.

A- Golden color, hazy liquid, white head.

T- Lime, salt, funky, tart, slightly sour, subtle vinegar.

P- Light body, average texture, medium carbonation, funky finish.

O- Okay stuff, but not really my thing. Lots of funk and lime. These all start to taste the same after a while.
Tap @Warpigs. Super clean and tart, easy drinking and flavourful. A classic saison but less breads and more tart fruit taste. Really good
Tap at cbc16, copenhagen. Hazy light orange color, white head. Aroma has fruits, peach, some hoppy notes. Nice fruity taste, peach, some earthy notes.
Sample @ CBC-16, Copenhagen 13/5-16. Fruity with funky notes, citrus and some spices. Dry finish.

On tap @ CBC 2016. Hazy orange body, small white head. Nose is fresh citrus juice, straw, pale malts, gooseberries, red berries and hints of grape peel, wild yeast and wood. Taste is stable funk, lemon juice, citric peel, pale malts, minerals, white wine, wood and hints of gooseberries, straw and lactic sour notes. Medium body, dry finish, high carbonation. Lovely, tart and fruity saison, utterly balanced and super-refreshing. Amazing, totally worth its rating.
Tap@ CBC 2016. Light orange, thin white head. Funky, tart fruits. Tart, sweet fruits, rhubarb. Somewhat complex. Floral notes as well.
Tap at CBC2016, Copenhagen. Colour is cloudy reddish orange with small white head. Aromas and flavors: Fruits, citrus, Belgian yeast and malts.
From Tap. Trübes hell goldgelbes Bier mit einer geringen weißen Schaumkrone. Geruch säuerlich fruchtig, Kraut, Gewürze. Geschmack trocken, säuerlich fruchtig, Kraut, holzig.
Tap at warpigs. Aroma of citrus, orange and grapefruit. Fruity and zesty. The flavours starts sour but finish light bitter. Dry. The body is light and the texture is juicy. Good...

Tap @Warpigs, Cph. Pours hazy orange with a small, creamy white film head. Aroma has, sweet malts, oranges, red apple, funk. Medium carbonation, fine dry and quite creamy mouthfeel. Flavour has funk, light tartness, oranges, apple zest. Very fresh and drinkable.

From tap at Warpigs, Hill Farmstead Day. It pours hazy orange with a small white head. Fruity and acidic aroma. Zesty oranges and grapefruit. High zesty flavor with a nice acidic kick. Oranges and lemon juicy. Quite bitter finish but so refreshing!
Tap @ Warpigs, tap take over. Hazy matt yellow with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, fruity and bretty. Flavor is medium sweet and light acidic. Sweet and light acidic finish. 120516

75cl bottle shared by a friend, poured a slight unclear light amber orange colour with a white head. nose of crisp minerals, fresh lime, malty, orange, bitter blood orange, crackers, taste is such a threat, lovely summer fruits, refrehinng citrus, lots of bitter blood orange in the taste aswell. awesome.
shared 750 ml bottle. Out of two versions - 2015 and 16 - 16 killed it. Big tropical fruit notes. Yeasty goodness. Lime. Nice.
25 oz bottle lugged to FL from brewery. Translucent peach color pour, small white peripheral head. Aroma of yeast, lemon. Mildly tart lemon, grass. Light body. Prickly carbonation. Very smooth.

750ml Bottle (Thanks Omhper) - Hazy orange in colour. Lime, orange and some musty notes in the aroma. Pink grapefruit, lemon, lime, orange and leather can be detected in the refreshing and slightly sharp taste.

Bottled, thanks hackobock!  Hazy orange / golden, small head. Tart floral nose. Dry and slender with light-medium body and crisp rounded mouthfeel. Lemony sourness, some hay, lillies and cobwebs. Salty bitterish finish. Elegant.

searching .. . spritzy gold .. foam from alka seltzer, then pillows nicely .. lime, grass, orange, sour citrus .. . mouth is just a bit to bubbly, but a very sleek beer, we all enjoyed it .. . . as long as you bring a side dish.

Bottle, from dresden-- thanks tons Steve! Hazy bright yellow, lively white head that laces thickly. Beautiful combination of funk and dry, lightly perfumey citrus (lime rind), clean light crackery malts. Complex yet so incredibly drinkable! Just love this style of saison!!
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: On tap @ Øst, Stavanger. Pours golden, with a creamy head. Aroma is saison yeast with notes of cereals, hay and wood, as well as fruity notes of peaches and plums, and some grassy notes. Medium body, with soft carbonation. Flavour is bone dry yeast, with bretty wood, as well as some perfumey, farmyard and rustic earthy notes. Lingering tart finish.
Bottle. Pours mostly clear yellow with some white head. Nose and taste are lime and blood orange. Nice sharpness in the taste.

750 ml bottle -- supposed to be shared, but no one else wanted a sour. Oh well! Extremely pleasant -- the aroma is saison yeast, lime, and some faint floral notes, and the taste is crisp, slightly sour, and really balanced. Another outstanding beer from Greensboro, VT.

On tap at ØST, Stavanger. Pours hazy golden with a small white head. Aroma is inviting, with oranges and flowers in the front. Dry, fresh and moderate crisp taste, well balanced with a dry lingering fruity finish.

[My bottle (750ml) shared with HogTownHarry, GregClow, jercraigs & mabel -- c/o Glouglouburp] Pours a hazy yellow-gold with an average size semi-lasting bubbly white head and minimal lacing. Aroma starts good and gets better and better. Lots of fruit -- blood orange and more -- along with yeast, herbs and light hops. Pleasant tart flavour, citrusy, yeasty and herbal. Medium bodied. Fin great stuff, wish I had tons of it!

Pours cloudy orange with thin white head. Nose is sour and fruity. Aromas are citrus (lime, grapefruit), hay, maybe a pumpkin note. Strong sourness. Average carbonation, medium body. Long sour finish. I didn't get the Hawaiian hibiscus and the cotton evokes by another member! ;)

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Refrigerated 75 cl brown bottle poured into a tulip. Orange with medium white head. Aroma is light funk, light body, well carbonated, and good small-bubble lacing. Taste is slightly tart, some funk, some citrus, some bitterness, and slightly dry finish.  Easy to drink, if you like the dryer ones this might be a favorite.  I recall preferring Anna.

Tap. Parker Pie Co. West Glover, VT. Hazy gold with the lightest tinge of pink. Constant stream of fine bubbles. Thin, lasting, dense white head. Nose is floral and herbal. Saison yeast character to it. Some orange rind. Sweet grain. Soft caramel malts. Taste is tart and zesty bitter. Palate is crisp and brightly spritzy. Zesty bitte finish with a little dryness.
Beautiful peach pour, small soapy white head. Aroma of tart cherries, flavor of champagne, peach, lime. Very crisp.
Bottle. Hazy golden body with a medium white head. Like, fruity, hops, light yeast, citrus, ginger notes, floral. Nice.

This is a pleasantly crowned 750 ml bottle, purchased from the brewery retail shop last Wednesday afternoon. Paid $10.  The pour is a grotesquely magnetic (heavily) cloudy safety carrot orange: a trim unretiring white-ringed head 1 finger in length stood atop.  Immediate aromas of carrot skins, red cabbage, Hawaiian hibiscus, lime meat, tangerine zest, farmhouse yeast, Lady & Northern Spy apple cores, citrus-forward hops, white pepper, sweat, cotton, and a brief pumpkin seed note.  Tastes much the same: with additions of: wheat grain, crushed coriander, a touch of hard water minerality, plastic, and boiled rice.  Particularly enjoyable. Not exactly what I was thinking it would be. Reminds me more of an unspicy soured salsa saison that another Mimosa.

Opens as a bit of a gusher but its not too bad. Lost about an ounce/ounce and a half before it settled. Pours a very cloudy, dark golden orange color with tangerine hues and a three finger, frohy white head that very slowly settles into a lasting ring. Good retention with large chunks of soapy lacing left behind. 

Slight earthy floral aroma with a strong citrus character and prominent spicy zest. Only subtle farmhouse character with slight musty funk. Could use more barnyard/farmhouse/saison character but its dominated by peppery spice, bready yeast, tropical hops and citrus fruit. Theres a bit more farmhouse quality as it warms but theres still too much going on and the strong citrus presence hinders the other flavors. 

Medium body with crisp carbonation and a blast of overwhelmingly sour, tart citrus flavor. There is a ton of lime flavor which almost completely obliterates the farmhouse and saison characteristics. Intensely dry and puckering citrus flavor, like a few ounces of lime juice was dumped into the bottle. All lime juice and citrus zest. Slightly peppery and spicy but after a while, when the palate adjusts, the saison notes very subtly start to show up. Subtle farmhouse funk, spicy hops and tropical fruit. Grassy with faint barnyard character but again, the citrus is so strong and overpowering it kills off everything that I enjoy about the style. Needs balance and has way too much citrus/lime flavor. Very disappointing.

750 mL bottle. Originally reviewed 9/16/2013.
 Pale orange body. Nice white head. Sticky lacing. Chunky collar and wisps on the surface.

Smells of lime. Lots of lime. Pale malt, but mostly zesty. Almost a bit peppery.

Taste is also super limey. Almost tart. Pale malt. Some stone fruits. The peppery flavors are gone. Bright lime citrus finish.

A crisp saison. Medium high carbonation. 

The lime gives it a tangy finish. Another solid saison from Grassroots.

Shared at a bottle share, hosted by Mickey before the U-of-M game on October 10. Poured from a 750 mL bottle that I brought. The pour is a nice foggy orangey-gold with a nice thick white head and some great lacing as it falls down. The aroma is pretty good. I wasnt expecting this one. Its got a lot of lime citrus, a little pepper, and some solid funkiness. Its light and crisp. The flavor mimics this. There seems to be a little more tropical fruit in it with the distinct lime and lemon zest coming through on the forefront. The flavor is just like the nose, in that it just is crisp and clean. The mouth feel is a little thin, but the carbonation really helps out here. There is an excellent crispness to it, and for me not being a fan of saisons, this is just good. I need to drink more Hill Farmstead stuff now.

Bright sunny orange. Fast-vanishing dotty head. Very dry, clean and straightforward. Almost dusty and slightly funky (not very). Touch of citrus sweetness in the periphery. Medium carbonation and short-lived. Simple and good but not unbelievable.

Hazy golden colour, white head. Fruity aroma, orange peel, yeast and funk. Bitter flavour, quite fruity, funky yeast, apricot, lemon zest, floral note. Fruity finish, zest and yeast.
(from 75cL bottle @ ZZT XII, Getting Joesd to it, Oirschot. Thanks for sharing, Koen!)
Bottle @ ZZT12. Hazy yellow with no real head. Smells very fruity, fresh, brett, leather. Tastes fruity, slightly sour, fresh. Medium body, soft carbo.

Bottle @ ZZT XII. Hazy yellow color, small white head. Aroma is sourish, some yeast and fruitpeel. Taste is decently balanced sour, fruitpeel, some yeast, orange. Suitable body, medium carbonation. Quite pleasant.
Geel ondoorzichtig bier met een kleine witte schuim kraag. Ruikt fruitig, zurig, boerderij. Smaakt ook zo.
Bottle to glass. Pours a mostly clear light orange color with an off white head. Aroma is

The Well, Brooklyn tap: pours a really pale gold with a small white head. Atoma is light citrus, plenty of funk, some light winy or vinegary notes. Taste is sour. Body is really light. Combined this is enticing and upon consumption it is mouthwatering. Dank.

Courtesy of Darshan

Bottle. Hazy yellow with a medium sized white head with good lacing. Wonder ful nose with fruit and barnyard, dust, flowers. Flavour is mostly fruity and floral. Peach, apricot, hibiscus, hay, dust, wood, light pepper. Medium body, creamy texture with soft carbonation, some sweetness, light acidic. Soft, drinks well.

Bottle. Pours golden orange with a thin white head that lingers. Smells of lime and farmstead yeast. Lime tart - not my style. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a vibrant, hazed golden-orange color, with a sizzling, huge white head, slowly fading down to a glass coating lacing.

The nose is full of tart lemon zest, accompanied by white bread, funky cheese and leather, building the beers foundation. Its fruit impression gets enhanced by sour blood orange rind and wet mushrooms. All in all the aromas feature an intriguing balance between tart fruits and pleasant funk, coming well together, with notes of old potatoes, forest flowers and saw dust.

Has an incredibly smooth mouthfeel to it, while the carbonation remains unusual high, which leads to an outstandingly pleasant drinking experience, finishing with soft mineralic qualities. 

Tastes of matured hops, hay, lemon rind and dough bread, while its fantastic mouthfeel and clean design reveals a plethora of nuances, encouraging me to keep on drinking. The beers refreshing qualities reveal themselves, as luscious, funk coated blood orange gets introduced. It packs a rich fruitiness, as well as a bitter punch, successfully balanced by hay and crackers. Its aqueous, mineralic quality gets the most noteable during the finish, due to a fusion of lively carbonation, blood orange and lime, creating a sappy, bitter, pleasantly funky finish, with a hint of fructose to it, adding even more depth to the bitterness.

While this is certainly funky and tart, fruits are the mvp in this beer. The main difference to the popular fruit juice ipas is, that this beer is not entirely based on the fruits. It entangles them into recognizable barnyard qualities, which all benefit from the beers fantastic balance, opening the palate to many details, which becomes the beers biggest strengh overall. Very unique in taste, successfull on all fronts, while remaining its focussed freshness, this one is a winner.

Bottle from a trade with my good Rochester homie, thanks Justin. Pours a cloudy off golden almost more orange, massive white head that dies to nothing, no lacing. Nose is sweet, tart, orange and zest, perfumy, a touch barnyard. Tastes sweet, tart, orange, hibiscus, a little bitter, dryish. In a word, fantastic.
Another winner from HF. Cloudy and orange with aromas of wheat and lime. Flavors include lime, wheat, fruit, citrus. Mildly tart.  So good, so refreshing.

Cloudy bright orange gold with a billowy off white head. Nose is tart with lots of citrus, crushed pepper, and tropical fruit. Very nice flavor with lots of acidity and citrus rind. Bright fruit and citrus in the mouth with peppery notes. Dry and boss
Bottle @ Dangerous Bottleshares meets Arla Unika. Pale yellow pour with a frothy head. Notes of lime, orange, funk with some lingering light citrus. Fizzy and refreshing!

Pours light golden with a thin white head. Floral notes with pear, apple, citrus, yeast and a pinch of pepper. Delicious Aroma!! Taste; Fruity citrus, lime, apple and pear with a malty touch and a little sting of pepper! This one is amazing!

A: Orange with a hint of pink in. Big head that disappears fast. N: Lemon, floral, lime, hay, some pepper. T: Orange, pepper, hay, zest. O: Very nice tart and spiced saison with long lasting taste! I get lots of pepper and citrus all the way through. Lovely!

Sample at the Northeastern Brewery (VT) Tasting on 08/16/2015. Hazy deep golden color with a medium white head that diminishes steadily to a film. Strings of lacing o the glass. Aroma of funky fruit, yeast and malt. Light-bodied with flavors of funky brett, citrus, yeast and malt. The finish is fruity with an herbal yeast aftertaste. Good beer all around.

Bottle at home with friends. Tulip pour is yellowish haze with big head. Aroma is big light fruits like pear, apple, some citrus, some light floral notes, straw, honey, and funky yeasts. Tastes are similar with the citrus, pears, apples, funky yeasts, barrel, light pepper, and honey with flowers. Tart, carbonated finish. Crisp and delicious.

Bottle. Pours all cloudy light straw yellow with huge frothy white head. Aroma is packed with deliciousness. Floral, saison yeast, zesty, sweet and tart wheat, crates, lime, spicy, grapefruit, white grapes, peppery. Funky dry brett notes. Taste is very well balanced. Orange, zesty, what, saison, white pepper, tart wheat, funky brett, un-ripe pear, quite tart and with funky hay notes. Grapefruit and sour. Really smooth wheaty feel along fizzy carbonation. White grapes and long acidic finish with lime zest. Slight flowery notes all way trough and smooth wheat to balance out the sour notes.

Bottle @ Niels. Cheese tasting. Hazy straw yellow, small white head, nice lacing. Aroma, malty, hoppy, fruity, yeast, spices, peber, citrus, grass, lime, lemon, . Taste, malty, fruity, tropical, lemon, lactic, white grapes, peber, grapefruit, pine. Dry mouth feel. High carbonation, almost fizzy.

Bottle thanks to Bursprak. Pours a light, hazy yellow with a huge, white head. Aroma has dry floral notes, spicy funk, corianders, slight honey, saison yeast, white pepper. Magnum (I believe 2014) shared by Adam C on 7/25/15.Bright pale-golden body is well-carbonated and topped by a foamy, white head that shows moderate retention. Good clarity.Again, very well-presented/constructed Belgian aromatics in the nose. Peppery phenols, light plaster, floral notes and very, very mild acids. A good deal of light vanilla-cream-like maltiness and just a pinch of lime in the nose. No sign of the blood orange nor any alcohol or flaw. Really cant reiterate enough how refreshing it is to see a brewer doing unique Belgian ales that arent just a noseful/mouthful of brett or conversely, a mess of brutish peach/banana/apple esters.The flavor is given a bit more to the lime, though nowehere is it overdone. Rather it balances against the malt, which, while not overly sweet, still provides enough body and, in concert with the always tight carbonation from HF, another perfect mouthfeel. Soft fruit esters (apricot, nectarine) and light pepperiness are all enjoyable, while minimal funk has developed. Adam was a bit disappointed that it hadnt really funkified over the course of its year in bottle, but it didnt bother me. Still incredibly drinkable and with warming, you can pinpoint the lightly tart, citrusy blood orange, if you know to look for it. Another gem from Hill Farmstead....
Heavy barnyard, waves of orange/lime/hibiscus, some minerality, moderate acid, extremely dry, tannic finish.

text: Bottle thanks to Leighton. It pours cloudy light orange with a decent white head. The nose is earthy, funky, musty, apricot, sour peach, floral, red berry and doughy. Fantastique saison fermière brassée que je suis fier de présenter comme étant le fruit dune collaboration entre cette brasserie de renommée mondiale et un ex brasseur de chez Dieu Du Ciel! De cette union entre le Ciel et la Terre est née une bière tant originale que respectueuse des grandes traditions vermontoises. La Brother Soigné présente une robe rosée qui rire sa couleur de lhabile mélange doranges sanguines et de fleurs dhibiscus. La tête étant discrète, la voie est parfaitement libre permettant aux arômes de levures sauvages, de fruits frais et de pelouse de prendre le contrôle de mes narines éblouies. Le liquide est jeune, léger, vivant. Une belle petite pétillance vient amuser mon palais tandis que les justes saveurs sauvagines et fraîches comblent lensemble de mon pharynx. Tout est très délicat et je me retrouve à me demander si je naurais pas souhaité que les saveurs fussent plus accentuées. En fait, la réponse est non, et cest justement pour cette raison que cette bière est si bien réalisée: les nuances sont subtiles et raffinées. Merci à ces grands brasseurs de nous offrir de pareils produits et longue vie au brother maintenant soigné!

(750ml bottle @ Mikkeller & Friends, shared with my lovely girlfriend Jan 9, 2015) Pours a hazy pale orange with a huge and extremely lacy white head that gushes slowly for a while and requires me to perform bottle fellatio to contain it while wandering around looking for seats. Aroma quite fruity and also noticeably funky. Blood orange flesh, lime peel, dried apricot, a bit grassy, white pepper, earthy barnyard hay Hill Farmstead character with lime juice acidity underneath. Juicy tart fruit up front with lots of bright lime and rich orange, nectarine too I think. A very light malt sweetness in the middle to balance the acidic quality but citrus leads. Drying into the finish, still acid core but joined by wet hay with very light funk, restrained herbal hops and a bevy of citrus zest flavours that give a bitter aftertaste. Slight minerality in the finish. Light bodied with big aggressively effervescent carb. A study in citrus, refreshing and very complex saison.

Pours a vibrant golden straw color, frothy white head, nice retention...nice lacing as it breaks down and fine carbonation racing up the glass. Gorgeous beer. Bottle via and shared with oakbluff. Gold in colour with strong carbonation. Aromas are a blend of floral lime, pink peppercorn and a bit of orange. Beautiful hazed apricot appearance. Blood orange, lime, papaya fruitiness in the aroma framed in the limestone and misty grass funk of HFs house character. Heavily calcified. Tempered, tart flavor with much of the fruitiness of the nose contained somewhat; rather, pithy zests pair with crackling, rustic spice and field grass character for a whimsical, classic effect. The acid level is pleasant, buoying the lingering fruit qualities while also carrying the overall flavor toward a more detailed overall impression than is often found in an additive-focused example like this. The palate is fulsome but of course not heavy; juicy up front and semi-dry in the middle. Pulsing acidity and cheese rind in the extensive finish. Not a world-beater here, but another worthy addition to the lexicon of excellence coming from this little corner of the world.

Draught at MikkellerBar. Clear yellow/golden - white head. Citrus. Acid. Fruity. Peppery. Nice acid. Herbal. Light thyme. Apple. Super fresh. Super nice.
Tap, gold pour, white head, taste is funky, nose is barnyard, lemon, pepper, zesty, interesting saison

S: Funky barnyard funk, limes and oak. P: Hazy yellow but still a pretty clear beer with a thin white head. t: Limes and sour barnyard funk, some oak, some flowers and light spices. M: Medium body and soft carbonation. O: Great saison, that was a bit sour, had no idea this was brewed with limes, hisbiscus, and blood oranges, know that I read the description my notes make sense. Also thought this one was a bit like Anna which is just as good as this one.
Tap at Mikropolis Cloudy yellow small white head. Aroma is fruity wood yeast spices. Herbal hoppy notes. Flavor is citrussy lemon yeast. Wild yeast great bitter hoppy balance

Belle couleur dorée, opaque avec un beau col mousseux blanc. En bouche cest merveilleux, agrumes,céréales,vin blanc, un petit coté surette fort agréable. Une saison assez complexe qui se boit tout seul. Définitivement une des meilleurs Saison au monde!

Aroma and taste is medium sweet floral and fruity, some barnyard light spicy yeasts, zesty orange and lemon citrus, light grassy and floral nuances, light tartness on the palate, light dry finish. Lovely.

UPDATED: DEC 2, 2015 Tap @ Mikkeller and Friends. Pours hazy golden with a white medium fluffy head. Aromas of lime, grass, slight tartness, orange peel. Taste is blood orange, orange peel, lime, grass, spices. That blood orange really comes through in the end. Damn!
Draught. Hazy yellow colour with medium white head. Aroma of straw and citrus with flavour of yeast and flowers, even note of honey nice refreshing with crispy taste and smooth finish.
Bottle. Hazy to cloudy straw color, big white head. Aroma of earthy barnyard and attic corners, dusty citrus. Taste is bready, funky, a bit sweaty, malty, fruity, complex and tasty.
Great Gose. Lots going on - citrus, salt, wheat, a hint of funk. Very easy to drink. Top of the food chain.

Magnum bottle shared by Luc. Bright pale golden color, very cloudy, fine head. distinctive HF yeast in the nose, lemon, wheat, sulfur. Salty flavor, lemon, saltine crackers, lime. Lovely, gose-like. Great level of sourness. Very approachable.

Tap @ Mikkeller & Friends. Pours a hazy golden with a tiny white head. Aroma is quite tart with lots of citrusy notes of blood orange, lime and squeezed lemon. Behind this I get some more floral notes along with some apple cider vinegar and some more funky notes as well. Also some dry champagne notes in there. Woah this is complex and mouthwatering. The taste is citrusy and tart with notes of lime, blood orange, green apples, dry champagne and apple cider vinegar. Also some funk behind all of this. Very sour for a saison but oh man how I could drink this stuff all the time! Auch!

Hazy golden color. Huge lime, hibiscus, sour, salt, in the nose, but uber well integrated. Dry, salty, sour, lime and grapefruity. Super super quaffable. Unbelievably approachable beer that is not a saison, but can redefine a session beer. Just out of this world and needs to be drunk to understand.

Draft @ Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen. Pours a hazy yellow color with a small white head. Has a fruity spicy yeasty citric citrus aroma. Fruity tart citric citrus bitter flavor. Has a fruity tart spicy yeasty citrus finish.
Draught @ Mikkeller & Friends. Pours yellow with a small white head. Aroma is fruity, citrus and some funk. Palate is fruity, fresh, easy and enjoyable with some tartness.

750ml bottle. Wow. Rather optimum, perfect Saison. Hazy yellow tan. The blood orange and lime really work well here, balancing the saison yeast and complementing it. Perfect mouthfeel. World Class. Nice sour twang and perfect clean malt. Wow.

Tap at Mikkeller & Friends. Smell is fresh and has some notes of honey and fruits. Pours yellow with a small white head. Taste has some notes of grapes, apples and some malts. Palate is easy and enjoyable. Overall a great beer! Fresh and tasteful, yet easy and drinkable

Pours hazy golden low white head
Aromas of garden flowers, barnyard, citrusy fruits, funk
Taste has sour grapes, hints of green apples, hay, grass, meadow field, citrusy fruits. Freakin brilliant!

UPDATED: MAY 15, 2015 Mikkeller and friends. Cloudy yellow with a small white head. Citrus and floral aroma with fresh cut grass and a little funk. Dry and tart flavour with citrus and a notable herbal note. Tasty!

UPDATED: OCT 11, 2014 On tap at Mikkeller Bar, Viktoriagade. Deep golden colour with an amber tint. Thin, white head. Fruity aroma with lemons, yeasts, bretts - rather tart. Taste is bitter. Medium body with a creamy texture and a soft carbonation. Dry and fruity finish with yeasts and pale malts. Very enjoyable saison, rather a lot of bretts.

UPDATED: OCT 11, 2014 Pours hazy yellow with low white head. Aroma of wheat, bretta, grass, green grapes, lime. Taste is lime sour up front, followed by smooth sweet then a sour finish. Body is smooth and crisp with average carbonation. Like drinking a margherita!

Bottled. A hazy golden beer with a beige head. The aroma has notes of dusty hops, straw, and malt. The flavor is sweet with notes of spicy hops, malt, straw, and yeast, leasing to a bitter and tart finish.
Bottled. Golden coloured. Hazy. Dense off White head. Aroma. Sterin, yeast, fruits, Light sourness. Flavour. Citrus, yeast, fruits, Spice. Medium bodied. Ends citric and yeasty.

Bottle at Mikkeller & Friends.
Hazy golden colored with a small white head.
Fruity aroma of hay and peaches with notes of hops and pine needles.
Fruity and light acidic flavor of peaches and barnyard with notes of hops.
Tart finish.

75 cl bottle. Pours hazy yellow with a huge white head. Aroma is smooth fruity and light estery. Citrusy and light bretty. Grapefruity and citrusy. Smooth fruity and peachy hoppy. Smooth fruity and citrusy finish.

Bottle at tasting.
APPEARANCE: clouded blond beer, small unstable white head.
NOSE: sour, fresh, fruity, lactic, lemon.
TASTE: sour, lemon, lactic, fruity.

[5671-20130817] Bottle. Fruity yeast aroma. Slightly hazy, orange body with a medium-lasting foamy white head. Bitter grassy yeast flavour. Medium body. Good. (7/3/8/4/15) 3.7
(@ Campground Brewdown 2013, Millmont, PA)

Bottle courtesy of Rick G. of Lardo. Colour...very cloudy light straw with a thick white head. Nose....massively acetic with grape pips, stone fruit skin and massive yeast. Palate...very tart and puckery with loads of acetic quality and tons of lime zest! The yeast is here too, as is plenty of generalised fruit. This is a vibrant, bright and lively ale with loads of character!

750 ml. bottle sampled @ Pure Apricot Tasting. Obtained in a trade with AdamJackson. Hazy citrus, lemon appearance, little white head. Huge lacto nose, sour, lime, citrus peel, hay, yeast, Huge lime taste, lemon peel, lots of sour lacto, almost touch vinegar, white bread, hay, faint barn, lots of peel, Almost vinegar punch in the back. Lacto / white bread body. Very nice but where is my blood orange?? I liked quite a bit but I did expect a bit more honestly, others really liked so glad that they were happy so this might be just a personal thing / expectations.
Golden, white frothy head. Nose is big lime, citrus, tart. Taste is lime and blood oranges, nice tartness.

Pours hazy orange with a medium frothy white head. Aromas of lime, citrus, lemongrass, coriander, honey, farmhouse, hay, grass. Taste is lme, lemongrass, funk, slight orange, honey an grass notes. Mouthfeel is tart and dry with medium carbonation. Absolutely world class! Ridiculously well balanced!

Bottle major thanks to Tom10101 for hooking me up with a bottle of this. Cloudy yellow pour with two fingers of lively white head. Aroma is mild funk, loads of citrus, and barnyard. Taste is citrusy funk, lively carbonation, bone dry finish, with mild tartness. This a very refreshing saison, very clean, crisp, not quite as funky as the aroma suggests, but an excellent example of the style. So happy to have tried this.
Taste wine barrel.. Lime and blood orange characteristics. Medium yellow and lace sheet.

Tasted on 2/8/14 from a 750mL bottle at the RBWG Grand Tasting, big thanks to Maxxdaddy for sharing!!! Pours cloudy pale yellow with a thick white head that leaves a thick collar of lace. The nose is spicy saison yeast with plenty of lime zest, spicy floral hibiscus, and white bread malt. The flavor is the same zesty lime, spicy floral hibiscus, saison yeast, and fresh orange. The body is medium with light tannin, lively carbonation and a long complex finish that runs the gamut of all flavors mentioned above.

750ml bottle pours a hazy gold with some slim white head. Nose has some nice, pithy citrus, white grapefruit, fair amount of perfume, some lime, mildly vegetal, some yogurt too. Flavor is limey, lemony, yogurt, some herbs, some grapefruit, some orange, tart and lactic. Full bodied, finish. Solid.
UPDATED: AUG 24, 2014 This beer was made from the blood and tears of Jesus himself. Cloudy yellow pour. Aromas of God. Taste is godlike. Flavors of Jesus sweat and tears. Mind = Blown.

Thanks to mendvicdog for the share.

The beer is hazy and straw yellow with a small white head. The aroma brings lemon, hay, funk, straw, yeast, sunshine. Lovely flavor. Tart with prominent citrus character. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Really tasty. Another winner from Shaun.
Bottle. Pours a bubbly light gold with minimal head. Strong flavors of the lime and sour blood orange up front that mellows as you swallow. A very different beer. Not bad in small doses.

Bouteille 05-2014. Je nai absolument pas été impressionné par cette bière à la lime et aux oranges sanguines. Un liquide jaune trouble à la manière dune blanche. Les bulles par contre sont très fines. Un nez dorange de Séville et dépices. Rien de plus rien de moins. Un goût de bille gâche la bouche. Une sorte de jus dorange du matin dun lendemain de brosse. Mince en bouche et aucune longueur. Simple. Totalement surévalué.

750 ml bottle shared by Pat, thanks! Pours a clear bright hazy golden straw yellow with lasting white head that fades to moderate lacing. Aroma is saison yeast, hay, citrus with lime and blood orange and hibiscus. Flavor is same with bright lime intensity over the saison complexity. Bright carbonation, medium bodied, lime zest finish. Delicious.

Bottle; Pour is murky golden with a chunky white head into this glass - well - a product of this bottle doing a little gushing upon careful opening. The white head dissipates into something of a modest light layering - there is a sticky lacing presence, albeit feint. The nose is floral dominant (hibiscus), and it moves to a clean mineral water note as Ive come to expect from a Hill Farmstead saison. Intertwined with the florals is a clear note of citrus spritz, as well as a touch of grain as well. It is nice, certainly - but I wasnt overly impressed by it, frankly. The flavor profile I find is where this primarily shines for me - You cant get that light bitter dominant tartness from the nose from the heavy citrus additions, nor that touch of butter cream intermixed into sweet slathered honey bread. This one begins and ends with lime citrus tart, and you do get a small sense of the blood orange flesh here - If not knowing it was there ahead of time, I would be hard pressed to guess, however. The floral note rounds things out beautifully but frankly has a greater effect on the nose. It finishes fairly robust, with a clean, semi dry ending. Its spiced with light pepper, moving to feint lemon, and doughy yeast. Its... everything I could currently want in a summer beer. Unfortunately - this is my one and only bottle.

Sample @ RBWG Asheville After Party. Gold pour with a small head. Orange and lemon. Christmas spices, herbs. Taste has some cantaloupe meat, lemons, tropical fruits brushed with herb. Lovely, zippy mouthfeel. Great.

Bottle... Cloudy golden pour with a mid-sized, wispy, white head. Good retention. The aroma is both funky and fruity - citrus peel and apricot. Medium to full-bodied and creamy with airy carbonation. The tart, bready flavor is flanked by a bright, tangy finish. Bottle courtesy of ctipping!

Look - Cloudy pale with a twist of lime colour. Aroma is dirty toilet water with some mild horse blanket in the mix. Taste is big lime citrus, nice tang. Very drinkable - great sessional beer. Dry finish. Overall, certainly one of the best balanced saisons ive had.
At my place with Taylor, Justin, Kristen, Matt, Jacob, Jen, other Matt. Pours neon orange. Aroma is peach, zesty citrus, bretty. Taste is very funky tart. Delicious all day drinker.
Bottle at Bobbys bullfrog/flora tasting. Yellow pour with white head. Light fruity yeast, floral, fruit and spice aromas. Herbal, floral spice, light citus flavors.

Bottle shared by a friend, who also brought back three of these for me so I could share with others. Clear gold pour with a medium white head. Aroma of funk, pepper, lemon, florals and orange. Malty flavor with white pepper and lime accents giving way to hibiscus before a tart orange finish. Pretty tasty.
Hazy gold with a thick white head. Aroma of citrus, grapefruit and lime, wheat, lacto and funk. Taste is tart, wheat and citrus, lots of lime, funky and delicious.
Grapefruit, berry, tropical, tangy, balanced by soft lactic touch. Light mineral touch. So delicate and amazing. Delicious.

Pour is a transparent pale gold with a tight white head. Nose is very clean, hints of lime and citrus with a balanced floral herbal note. Very light farmhouse funk and moderate yeast presence with a touch of peppery spice in back. Taste follows the nose, extremely refreshing especially on a hot day. A good bit of citrus and lime with a nice balance of the farmhouse yeast and a faint pepper in the back. A bit sweet and could use some more farmhouse characteristic. Body is light, carb is a touch on the lights side.

Hazy yellow with a pale head. Aroma is citrus peel, honey, grapefruit juice. Medium bodied, tart and citrusy on the palate, slightly dry finish. Flavours are ruby grapefruit, orange juice, hint of spice. Yum.

Poured from bottle into tulip: Pours clear straw with a a thick white head. Aroma of coriander, brett, hay, horse blanket, and a little citrus. Taste is mild citrus, coriander, champagne, medium tart, grass, and lots of brett. I normally dont like beers that are predominantly brett, but this one is relatively well balanced. Light body but still lots of flavor. This is a pretty nice beer.

Bouteille avec cette date : 05-2014. Une bière presque blanche avec une petite tête mousseuse qui ne laisse aucune trace. Au nez, la lime, les agrumes, les fleurs pimentées et les effluves de blé suri chassent les effets voulus de la levure. En bouche, cest décevant avec des saveurs incertaines ou diluées. Saison numéro 2 au monde? Vraiment? Je ne comprends rien à rien. En bouche, cest mince ou plutôt ordinaire ou normal. En finale, cest très et trop court, sans grande envergure. I am sorry but this one is not a Saison at all. Fruit beer? I think so.
Bottle, pours hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma of citrus and orange. Flavor is fresh blood orange with some sourness. Dry finish. Very refreshing.

Bottle thanks to Will. Pours a cloudy yellow with medium frothy white head that lasts. The aroma is hibscus and blood oranges. Thin mouthfeel with nice hibiscus, blood orange, lime juice and tart finish. Easy to drink, very impressive.

Bottle from Todd. Thanks! 

A: Big fluffy white head. Very clear gold body with lots of bubbles. 

N: Straw, pine, esters, lemon, lime, coriander, blood orange, hibiscus, biscuit. 

T: Quite sour without a little fruit and sweetness. 

M: Quite light, well carbonated. 

O: An interesting sour saison. (This is really a Sour/Wild) with good clean flavors. A beer I drank quite a bit of as it lacks the annoying sweet-tart non-complexity of other American Wilds.

750 ml bottle. Pours a cloudy orange color with a medium white head. A great fresh nose of fruit, oranges and clear floral notes. Lime, a bit of oranges in the flavor, herbal tea, a very light super drinkable brew. Very floral.
UPDATED: JUL 5, 2014 Bottle from brewtopia. Nose and taste of a lot of grass and flower. A tone of citrus and pine as well. A light tart citrus finish. Great beer.
